alert.note: Alert for Carter (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 1:02PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southeast Oklahoma, Johnston and Marshall. In southern Oklahoma, Carter and Murray. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing across portions of the warned area. This includes flooding across portions of US Route 177. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ardmore, Tishomingo, Dickson, Mannsville, Ravia, Russett, Reagan and northern Lake Texoma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
